name: interception
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C or U ] the action of stopping and catching something or someone before that thing or person is able to reach a particular place: the interception of enemy messagesinterception of They established a secure communications channel to prevent the interception of critical information.
[ C ] in team sports, the action of catching, stopping, or taking control of the ball as it is being passed between two players of the opposing team: An interception gave Philadelphia the ball again in Dallas territory with one minute left in the half. He made two vital interceptions to block efforts in the final minutes.
More examplesFewer examplesWe authorize the interception of any phone line the target is using.Collaboration with other countries' spies and interception of communications are both common.Troy completed 67% of his throws for 587 yards and three scores, with no interceptions. An interception 40 yards out allowed the Argentine an unchallenged sprint to the line.
